issue.title: [Doc] Document the difference between RecordBatch and Table in an FAQ fashion
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-1847](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1847). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1847?focusedCommentId=16738104) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
This is now documented in `docs/source/cpp/overview.rst`.
> Tables are collections of columns in accordance to a schema. They are the most capable dataset-providing abstraction in Arrow.
> 
> Record batches are collections of contiguous arrays, described by a schema. They allow incremental construction or serialization of tables.
